alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 20 at 2:45AM PDT until October 20 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet with local sets to 20 feet are expected on west and northwest facing beaches today. Surf will be highest through early this afternoon, then is forecast to subside to 6 to 9 feet this evening. However, elevated surf will continue through Saturday. There will be a high risk of dangerous rip currents through Saturday. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...Until 9 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will be highest on west and northwest facing beaches. Nuisance to locally minor coastal flooding is possible around the high tide early this afternoon. This concern is mainly for low-lying coastal areas such as beach parking lots and harbor walkways.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly locations in such conditions, so stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
